headline: CME Group and Nasdaq Extend Exclusive Nasdaq-100 Futures License Through 2039
summary: CME Group and Nasdaq (Nasdaq: NDAQ) today announced a ten-year extension of CME Group's exclusive license to offer futures and options on futures based on the Nasdaq-100 and other Nasdaq indexes, through 2039.

content.title: CME Group and Nasdaq Extend Exclusive Nasdaq-100 Futures License Through 2039
content.summary: CME Group and Nasdaq (Nasdaq: NDAQ) today announced a ten-year extension of CME Group's exclusive license to offer futures and options on futures based on the Nasdaq-100 and other Nasdaq indexes, through 2039.

headline: US exchanges set to reap windfall as market volatility fuels trading rush
summary: Major U.S. stock exchanges are expected to report higher second-quarter profits, driven by increased fee collection from record-breaking trading volumes as investors rushed to reposition portfolios hit by tariff-related volatility. Periods of heightened market volatility usually drive up trading volumes, and with it, transaction and clearing fees, which translate into better earnings for exchanges. In the second quarter, uncertainty sparked by U.S. President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs triggered volatility, exacerbated by tensions in the Middle East.
